topic.title: Enabling, Disabling and Restoring Backup/Restore Services

section.title: Stop, Start and Restart the Backup Services
section.p: To stop the Freezer backup and restore service globally, launch the following playbook from the lifecycle manager (this will stop all freezer-api and all freezer-agent running on your clusters):cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts freezer-stop.yml

To start the Freezer backup and restore service globally, launch the following playbook from the lifecycle manager:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts freezer-start.yml

To restart the Freezer backup and restore services use the ansible playbooks from above. cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts freezer-stop.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts freezer-start.yml
It is possible to target only specific nodes using the ansible --limit parameter.

ol.li: Run the following command to stop the freezer-agent:sudo systemctl stop freezer-scheduler or run the following command to start the freezer-agent: sudo systemctl start freezer-scheduler or run the following command to restart the freezer-agent:sudo systemctl restart freezer-scheduler

Run the following commands to stop the freezer-api:
sudo a2dissite freezer-modwsgisudo systemctl reload apache2or run the following commands to start the freezer-api: sudo a2ensite freezer-modwsgisudo systemctl reload apache2
